title: Story of a Stolen Heir. A novel
author: Bertram, James Glass.
snippet: The whole world had been electrified,when, by the cleverness of the great lawfirm of Lawson, Brodie, Craig, and Grinton, Mr. William Middlemass, an obscurehalf-pay captain, was found out to be thenearest heir to the eccentric old Sir GdbertBarnton, the wealthy banker and moneylender.

title: Story of a Stolen Heir. A novel

title: Story of a Stolen Heir. A novel

snippet: Mr. Joseph Liddell was the head clerkand confidential book-keeper of the greatfirm of Lawson, Brodie, Craig, and Grintonand as many knew, he was the private factotum of Mr. AUan Brodie as well.

title: Story of a Stolen Heir. A novel
author: Bertram, James Glass.
snippet: Ambition was his god,his ruUng passion—not the ambition of SirHenry Craig, his partner ; not a showydinner-giving, platform reputation; not thereputation of a planner of chques, or deviser of election tactics—he left that to thetalking partner of the firm, and to otherand less ambitious men.

title: Story of a Stolen Heir. A novel
author: Bertram, James Glass.
snippet: Sir Henry Craig of Pinkerton was themoving spirit of the business, so far as thepoUtics of the house were concerned—thecentre of Whig consultation—the partnerwho gave the dinner parties—who made allthe show and who " did" the speechifying,of which there was a great deal at thisperiod.

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: But whether she was grave or gay, or whether Icalled her to mind at St. Giles, listening with her gash-lookingfather to the preaching of Maister Craig or the fiery Knox, or atsome merrymaking, she was aye, to my mind, despite her fleer,the winsomest, the blythest, and the best-hearted lass in theworld.
